text: The 2015 Franken Challenge was a professional tennis tournament played on clay courts. It was the 28th edition of the tournament which was part of the 2015 ATP Challenger Tour. It took place in Fürth, Germany between 1 and 7 June 2015. ==Singles main draw entrants== ===Seeds=== {|class="sortable wikitable" |- ! width="70"| Country ! width="175"| Player ! Rank1 ! Seed |- | |Albert Ramos-Viñolas |63 |1 |- | |Blaž Rola |97 |2 |- | |Kimmer Coppejans |107 |3 |- | |Tobias Kamke |117 |4 |- | |John Millman |132 |5 |- | |Thiemo de Bakker |133 |6 |- | |Daniel Muñoz de la Nava |134 |7 |- | |Horacio Zeballos |142 |8 |} * 1 Rankings are as of May 25, 2015. ===Other entrants=== The following players received wildcards into the singles main draw: * Daniel Brands * Johannes Härteis * Maximilian Marterer * Florian Mayer The following players received entry as an alternate into the singles main draw: * Frank Dancevic The following players received entry from the qualifying draw: * Gonzalo Escobar * Lorenzo Giustino * Kevin Krawietz * Jordi Samper-Montaña ==Doubles main draw entrants== ===Seeds=== {|class="sortable wikitable" |- ! width="70"| Country ! width="175"| Player ! width="70"| Country ! width="175"| Player ! Rank1 ! Seed |- | |Rameez Junaid | |Adil Shamasdin |125 |1 |- | |Guillermo Durán | |Horacio Zeballos |162 |2 |- | |Gero Kretschmer | |Alexander Satschko |196 |3 |- | |Roberto Maytín | |Miguel Ángel Reyes-Varela |227 |4 |} * 1 Rankings are as of May 25, 2015. ===Other entrants=== The following pairs received wildcards into the doubles main draw: * Kevin Krawietz / Maximilian Marterer * Steven Moneke / Peter Torebko The following players received entry as an alternate into the singles main draw: * Marcelo Arévalo / Gonzalo Escobar ==Champions== ===Singles=== * Taro Daniel def. Albert Montañés, 6–3, 6–0 ===Doubles=== * Guillermo Durán / Horacio Zeballos def. Íñigo Cervantes / Renzo Olivo, 6–1, 6–3 ==External links== *Official Website Franken Challenge Franken Challenge Franken Challenge Category:Franken Challenge
